column8: Programa de mejora de la ciudadanía económica de las mujeres :: Promover la organización de las campesinas de Kimbondo, proporcionando el capital inicial necesario, para que gestionen en equipo sus propias explotaciones de hortalizas, sin tener que abandonar el cultivo de mandioca, base de la alimentación familiar, cuya responsabilidad recae en las mujeres, aumentando la producción y la productividad de su actividad. Se promueve la organización 50 mujeres campesinas, en situación de extrema pobreza y que en la actualidad realizan una agricultura de subsistencia, para la gestión de sus propias explotaciones de cultivo de hortalizas, lo que permitirá un aumento considerable de los ingresos que obtienen de su actividad productiva. OBJETIVO: General: Participación de las mujeres campesinas en el proceso de desarrollo de la comunidad rural de Kimbondo Específico: Aumentar la autonomía económica y financiera de las mujeres campesinas de la comunidad de Kimbondo, promoviendo su organización

column6: Construction of a pavilion for ill people for the Ground Reference Center for Health Dwe
column7: CONSTRUCTION OF A PAVILION FOR ILL PEOPLE FOR THE GROUND REFERENCE CENTER FOR HEALTH DWE
column8: Construcción de un pabellón de planta para enfermos para el Centro de Referencia de Salud de Dwe :: El proyecto pretende iniciar una reforma del Centro de Salud de Referencia de Dwe, posibilitando progresivamente una atención médica completa en una zona situada entre dos hospitales alejados en 100 kilómetro de Dwe.El actual Centro de Salud se encuentra muy desentendido, con graves carencias y deficiencias tanto a nivel de infraestructuras sanitarias como de personal médico. La demanda social p0or le derecho a la salud, ha hecho que se plantee un proyecto en varias fases para reformar el centro de salud existente, y así dotarle de unas infraestructuras necesarias para que pueda prestar un servicio adecuado a las necesidades de la población: construcción y equipamiento de un pabellón pediátrico, de una fosa para placentas, de un quirófano, un pabellón de planta y de atención a pacientes, dos bloques de letrinas y duchas y un depóstio de auga. Se plantea abordar la reforma en varias fases, de un modo posibilista y adecuado a la financiación que se vaya consiguiendo. En 2011 se empezó con la construcción del pabellón Pediátrico y la Fosa para Placentas (Ayuntamiento de Pamplona), construcción quirófano, depósito de agua y bloque de letrinas (Gobierno de Navarra) y un primer pabellón de enfermos, depósito de agua y 2º bloque de letrinas (Fondo 0,7% Trabajadores/as GV y Osakidetza). En esta siguiente fase continuaremos por la construcción y equipamiento del segundo pabellón de planta y atención a pacientes recién operados o en tratamientos, con la subvención solicitada al Ayuntamiento de Pamplona. Con ello se pretende atender las necesidades de salud de la población más vulnerable, entre las que destaca el trabajo para frenar el avance de enfermedades debidas a la desnutrición como el kwasiorkor.

10-CO1-002/CRE/Angola/2,4m?/ Fortalecimiento institucional y de la sociedad civil El Convenio se plantea con el objetivo de reducir los índices de pobreza en la provincia de Bié a través del fortalecimiento de las organizacion es de la sociedad civil y el apoyo a las instituciones responsables de f omentar el desarrollo económicoen la región. La zona de intervención, fu e especialmente castigada por la guerra, y actualmente presenta graves p roblemas de desestructuración social, económica y política, que comprome ten seriamente el desarrollo de la población, en situación de gran vulne rabilidad e inseguridad alimentaria y nutricional. La intervención propu esta para abordar estos problemas se basa en la ejecución de dos accione s complementarias. La primera de ellas, enmarcada en el sector de fortal ecimiento de la sociedad civil, se centra en el apoyo a las organizacion es de base para facilitar su participación en la vida pública. La segund a, dentro del sector de desarrollo agrario, auna actuaciones de desarrol lo institucional y creación de capacidades en las organizaciones de camp esinos que les permitan diversificar su actividad y mejorar su rendimien to de forma sostenible. Se trabajará en estrecha coordinación con los po deres públicos e instituciones locales, así como otros organismos de des arrollo presentes en la región.

column8: 10-CO1-028/JYD/Sudán/3,5m?/Educación básica, inserción laboral y generación de ingresos El presente convenio pretende contribuir al derecho a una educación basi ca, universal y de calidad mediante la construcción de un centro educati vo que incluirá una escuela de primaria y las primeras fases de una escu ela de secundaria y de formación profesional para cubrir parte de la alt a demanda en un país en reconstrucción tras veintitres años de guerra. E ste centro educativo, y las otras escuelas que el socio local gestiona e n la zona, no solo perseguirán medidas que favorezcan el accesoa la educ ación de aquella población más vulnerable y desfavorecida, sino que se c onvertirán en escuelas responsables en género favoreciendo de esta man era un cambio de mentalidad en la zona de impacto. Dichos centros a trav és de la herramienta de convenio servirán como base para promover una en señanza de calidad que sirva a través del fortalecimiento de las capacid ades de los ministerios de educación y trabajo para mejorar la calidad d e otros centros educativos, elaborando currícula,materiales didácticos y reglamentos de funcionamiento interno que puedan emplearse como modelo.

column6: Ngiri Triangle Integrated Conservation Project II
column7: NGIRI TRIANGLE INTEGRATED CONSERVATION PROJECT II
column8: Ngiri Triangle Integrated Conservation Project II

The investment is a 13 MW hydropower project in partnership with TrønderEnergi (TE) generating 82 GWh per annum. The total investment, including up-front financing fees, interest during construction and working capital is ca. 55 MUSD. Financing structure

Subsidising of forest establishment by the private sector. The funding is available for plots in the range of 25 to 3000 Ha, and the standards of seed quality, maintenance and management planning are strict. Furthermore the programme includes technical advice. About half of the plots are established on forest reserves through agreements with the NFA, whilst the remaining areas rest on private or communal land. Support to community groups is also being piloted (so far 200 Ha in 14 districts established). Support in collaboration with districts and district forest staff is being planed for in two districts. To date almost 11.000 ha have been established under the scheme.It has a climate effect through establishing forests to capture carbon, it has an environmental effect through the re-establishment of lost forests; is has economical implications and is a good example of Public-Private Partnership. It supports local organisation at two levels: community groups and producers organisations (Uganda Timber Growers Association has been established with support from the SPGS).

Reintegration of Child Soldiers. - Objective: i) Improve the socio - economic situation of 3000 former child soldiers affected by the war and facilitate their integration into the community. Improve skills of child soldiers and war affected youth through assistance from local authorities and local organisations. Beneficiaries will strengthen their economic situation through skills training in basic revenue generating activities and through participation in local credit and saving groups. - Beneficiaries are former child soldiers not included in formal demobilisation programs and war affected youth, around 3000 people . At least 50 percent of the beneficiaries are girls and young women, all sexual abused and becoming pregnant while associated to the armed groups and now excluded from their families. - Results: The economic situation of 3000 former child soldiers and war affected youth strengthened through skills training and active participation in local credit and saving groups. 3000 former child soldiers and war affected youth have received literacy training, information on HIV/Aids og reproductive health, civic society training and 300 have received vocational t

Community Development Project in Greater Khartoum. The aim of the project is to improve and develop the capacity of the local partner to carry out holistic community development work.Fida’s partner is Sudan Pentecostal Church which has approximately 20 local churches in the poor suburbs of Greater Khartoum. The church members are eager to help their communities but they need training and tools for it. The project trains community development trainers, who train volunteers, who work as advisors and support persons in their communities. The project focuses on two major components: Community Development Education (CDE) and HIV/AIDS.Through the project, the partner is equipped with growing know-how and skills within sustainable development work. This will contribute to the increasing impact of the partner’s work in community level.

The FinSom maternity clinic was founded in 2005 in the middle of a warlike situation. The clinic has become a established and respected slinic in the area and continues its activities despite the continuing difficulties. Due to war and destruction in the surrounding neighbourhood the nearest hospital is in the distance of two days instead of the earlier 30 km. The new project aims to improve the capacity of the clinc to take care of the emergency cases. The awareness raising to prevent FGM will continue as in earlier projects as well as the training of local traditional birth attendants.

The project focuses and revolves around the cross-cutting themes of health education income-generating skills training and gender equality. The aim is to enhance cross-cultural understanding micro-credit and other micro funding programmes create micro-businesses and end stigma and discrimination through promoting open dialogue and equal participation. The project strives to improve women?s sexual and reproductive health and to prevent domestic violence honour crime and female genital mutilation. This will be done through empowering and educating communities especially women and girls about safe sexual practices and their human rights.

The project is expected to increase basic educational level of 3000 returnees and especially women by offering community based literacy training health and sanitation education and agricultural skills training. Study programs also include civic education subjects such as local conflict resolution basic community health and community based development management training. The project is expected to increase local food production for consumption and income generating targeting about 600 families through training and advising small scale gardening initiatives in program communities.

column6: NGO Support / HAIK integrated Rural Development Project
column7: NGO SUPPORT / HAIK INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
column8: To improve the livelihood situation at household level within the target communities. 3rd phase of the project has encompassed social problems like the idleness of the youth poverty of women and problems related to harmful traditional practices in addition to agricultural and health related issues. Communities living in the program area are very poor in terms of agricultural productive health status potable water supply assets building opportunity and environmental condition. The experience gained in the first and second project phases (2006-2012) has significant inputs for designing third phase project document. The main objective of this project is to contribute in addressing the long term food insecurity problem of the target communities. The overall effect of these interventions is to reduce the problem of long term food insecurity and improve the living standard of people with in the target communities. The goal of the third phase is to contribute to the livelihood improvement in the target communities through improved health status potable water supply and enhanced agriculture production and household income level. Concrete outputs are partly similar as during the previous phases. However the 3rd phase focuses e.g. on unemployed youth who are in a risk of being wasted generation due to lack of work chat and HIV/AIDS and risky immigration as a solution for the situation.

column6: NGO Support / By Teaching a Girl You Teach the Whole Family
column7: NGO SUPPORT / BY TEACHING A GIRL YOU TEACH THE WHOLE FAMILY
column8: The aim of the project is to enhance writing and reading skills of the ten to fifteen years old by organising ervey day schooling and organise twise a week study groups to the women aged below 20 years. The purpose is to sustain the basic education in the Somalian circumstances where state schooling system doesn't exist. The purpose is to give children and younsters possibilities to continue the studies and possibilities to find a job. In addition the aim is to educate the teachers and give environmental human rights health and peace education.

column6: NGO Support / Godinlabe Primary school project
column7: NGO SUPPORT / GODINLABE PRIMARY SCHOOL PROJECT
column8: The state of schools in Godinlabe Galgadud is miserable in 16 years the schools have been totally neglected and the school houses have deteriorated. Not one public school is functioning at the moment and the children of poor families are out of education services. During the first year the project will repair 6 classrooms. Two seminars will be organized one on curriculum development and the other for parents on the importance of education. Four teachers will be recruited. The second year another six classrooms will be repaired. The projects aims that 600 young people will get their primary education during three years. 2009-2010: School repairing and support to the school continues. 2011-2013: Secondary school will start in order to improve student opportunities for higher education.

column6: Scaling up interventions to combat malaria in Cote d'Ivorie in the context of National reconstruction
column7: SCALING UP INTERVENTIONS TO COMBAT MALARIA IN COTE D'IVORIE IN THE CONTEXT OF NATIONAL RECONSTRUCTION
column8: Côte d’Ivoire is a country where Malaria is an endemic. Malaria is assessed as the foremost cause of morbidity and of mortality in the hospital. Pregnant women and children under five are most significantly affected populations. The Round 9 proposal supports the Strategic National Plan for 2006 to 2010 in scaling up Malaria interventions from 19 districts currently covered to the whole country and achieving universal access. The Program is implemented through the dual-track financing scheme by two Principal Recipients (PR). The activities undertaken by this PR include long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLIN) mass distribution campaign and information, education, and behavior change communication to support increased intermittent preventive therapy (IPT) and proper insecticide-treated net use.

column6: Scaling up of interventions to combat malaria in Cote d'Ivoire in the context of National Reconstruction
column7: SCALING UP OF INTERVENTIONS TO COMBAT MALARIA IN COTE D'IVOIRE IN THE CONTEXT OF NATIONAL RECONSTRUCTION
column8: Côte d’Ivoire is a country where malaria is an endemic. Malaria is assessed as the foremost cause of morbidity and of mortality in the hospital. Pregnant women and children under five are most significantly affected populations. The Round 9 proposal supports the Strategic National Plan for 2006 to 2010 in scaling up malaria interventions from 19 districts currently covered to the whole country and achieving universal access. The Program is implemented through the dual-track financing scheme by two Principal Recipients (PR). The activities undertaken by this PR include distribution of long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLIN), distribution of ACTS to health centers across all districts, information, education, and behavior change communication.

column6: Implementing the Strategic Framework for Prevention and Control of HIV/AIDS and Sexually Transmitted Infections within Somali Populations
column7: IMPLEMENTING THE STRATEGIC FRAMEWORK FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF HIV/AIDS AND SEXUALLY TRANSMITTED INFECTIONS WITHIN SOMALI POPULATIONS
column8: The estimated prevalence of HIV and AIDS in the adult population is 0.5 percent. The program supported by this grant focused predominantly on creating an environment that was more conducive to fighting HIV and AIDS. Measures financed by the grant included developing and strengthening overall coordination, technical and infrastructure capacity; strengthening health and civil society structures and services; and establishing pilot programs for treatment and care. The program targeted health professionals; community workers; people living with and affected by HIV and AIDS; local authorities, religions leaders and other gatekeepers; orphans and other vulnerable children; youth; mobile populations; and commercial sex workers and their clients.

column6: Project to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
column7: PROJECT TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS AND MALARIA
column8: Chad ranks among the least developed countries. A 2003 epidemiological study estimated HIV prevalence at around eight percent of the adult population, with 200,000 individuals infected with HIV. The program supported by this grant will scale up activities to enable the expansion of a comprehensive response to HIV and AIDS in the country, with a particular emphasis on the management of people living with HIV, including the provision of antiretroviral drugs, the care and support of orphans and other vulnerable children and the strengthening and expansion of voluntary counseling and testing services.
